weather_report:
Night has settled over Subiaco with a soft quilt of cloud drifting in and out of view; the stars appear, then recede, as if on a dimmer. It’s not a sunny evening at all—UV is effectively nil now—and the sky looks set to grow more overcast toward the small hours, trading scattered patches for a broader, duller ceiling. The air feels calm and clear enough for easy visibility, the kind of night where the streetlights do most of the work and the horizon is more suggestion than line.

It’s quietly pleasant rather than dazzling. A light layer will suit—an easy sweater or a soft jacket if you linger outdoors. If you’re stepping out, take an unhurried loop around the block or fetch a last-minute loaf for tomorrow’s breakfast; if you’re staying in, crack a window, put on a record, and tend to small, satisfying tasks: a tidy desk, a packed bag, a few pages of a book under a warm lamp. Expect more cloud as the night deepens and, with it, a gentler mood to carry you toward sleep.
